trans-unit.source: Syntax of database connection URLs for applications with embedded databases

target.mrk: Syntax of database connection URLs for applications with embedded databases

trans-unit.source: Database connection URL

seg-source.mrk: Database connection URL

target.mrk: Database connection URL

trans-unit.source: syntax in embedded mode

seg-source.mrk: syntax in embedded mode

target.mrk: syntax in embedded mode

trans-unit.source: For applications with embedded databases, the syntax of the database connection URL is

seg-source.mrk: For applications with embedded databases, the syntax of the database connection URL is

target.mrk: For applications with embedded databases, the syntax of the database connection URL is

trans-unit.source: jdbc:derby: [subsubprotocol:][databasename][;attributes]*

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby: [subsubprotocol:][databasename][;attributes]*

target.mrk: jdbc:derby: [subsubprotocol:][databasename][;attributes]*

trans-unit.source: [#$dp11]jdbc:derby:

seg-source.mrk: [#$dp11]jdbc:derby:

target.mrk: [#$dp11]jdbc:derby:

trans-unit.source: In JDBC lingo, derby is the subprotocol for connecting to a database. The subprotocol is always derby and does not vary.

seg-source.mrk: In JDBC lingo, derby is the subprotocol for connecting to a database.
The subprotocol is always derby and does not vary.

target.mrk: In JDBC lingo, derby is the subprotocol for connecting to a database.
The subprotocol is always derby and does not vary.

trans-unit.source: <i>subsubprotocol:<ph>

seg-source.mrk: <i>subsubprotocol:<ph>

target.mrk: <i>subsubprotocol:<ph>

trans-unit.source: Subsubprotocol

seg-source.mrk: Subsubprotocol

target.mrk: Subsubprotocol

trans-unit.source: part of database connection URL syntax

seg-source.mrk: part of database connection URL syntax

target.mrk: part of database connection URL syntax

trans-unit.source: subsubprotocol, which is not typically specified, specifies where looks for a database: in a directory, in a classpath, or in a jar file. It is used only in rare instances, usually for read-only databases. subsubprotocol is one of the following:

seg-source.mrk: subsubprotocol, which is not typically specified, specifies where looks for a database: in a directory, in a classpath, or in a jar file.
It is used only in rare instances, usually for read-only databases.
subsubprotocol is one of the following:

target.mrk: subsubprotocol, which is not typically specified, specifies where looks for a database: in a directory, in a classpath, or in a jar file.
It is used only in rare instances, usually for read-only databases.
subsubprotocol is one of the following:

trans-unit.source: directory

seg-source.mrk: directory

target.mrk: directory

trans-unit.source: classpath:

seg-source.mrk: classpath:

target.mrk: classpath:

trans-unit.source: Classpath

seg-source.mrk: Classpath

target.mrk: Classpath

trans-unit.source: accessing read-only databases from

seg-source.mrk: accessing read-only databases from

target.mrk: accessing read-only databases from

trans-unit.source: Databases are treated as read-only databases, and all databaseNames must begin with at least a slash, because you specify them "relative" to the classpath directory or archive. (You do not have to specify classpath as the subsubprotocol; it is implied.)

seg-source.mrk: Databases are treated as read-only databases, and all databaseNames must begin with at least a slash, because you specify them "relative" to the classpath directory or archive.
(You do not have to specify classpath as the subsubprotocol; it is implied.)

target.mrk: Databases are treated as read-only databases, and all databaseNames must begin with at least a slash, because you specify them "relative" to the classpath directory or archive.
(You do not have to specify classpath as the subsubprotocol; it is implied.)

trans-unit.source: jar Databases are treated as read-only databases.

seg-source.mrk: jar Databases are treated as read-only databases.

target.mrk: jar Databases are treated as read-only databases.

trans-unit.source: jar: requires an additional element immediately before the databaseName:

seg-source.mrk: jar: requires an additional element immediately before the databaseName:

target.mrk: jar: requires an additional element immediately before the databaseName:

trans-unit.source: (pathToArchive)

seg-source.mrk: (pathToArchive)

target.mrk: (pathToArchive)

trans-unit.source: pathToArchive is the path to the jar or zip file that holds the database and includes the name of the jar or zip file.

seg-source.mrk: pathToArchive is the path to the jar or zip file that holds the database and includes the name of the jar or zip file.

target.mrk: pathToArchive is the path to the jar or zip file that holds the database and includes the name of the jar or zip file.

trans-unit.source: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for examples of database connection URLs for read-only databases.

seg-source.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for examples of database connection URLs for read-only databases.

target.mrk: See the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite> for examples of database connection URLs for read-only databases.

trans-unit.source: databaseName

seg-source.mrk: databaseName

target.mrk: databaseName

trans-unit.source: Specify the databaseName to connect to an existing database or a new one.

seg-source.mrk: Specify the databaseName to connect to an existing database or a new one.

target.mrk: Specify the databaseName to connect to an existing database or a new one.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the database name alone, or with a relative or absolute path. See "Standard Connections-Connecting to Databases in the File System" in Chapter 1 of the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: You can specify the database name alone, or with a relative or absolute path.
See "Standard Connections-Connecting to Databases in the File System" in Chapter 1 of the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: You can specify the database name alone, or with a relative or absolute path.
See "Standard Connections-Connecting to Databases in the File System" in Chapter 1 of the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: attributes

target.mrk: attributes

trans-unit.source: Specify 0 or more database connection URL attributes as detailed in <xref href="rrefjdbc10889.dita#rrefjdbc10889"></xref>.
